description: From Middle English candelstik, candelstikke, from Old English candelsticca (“candlestick”), equivalent to candle +‎ stick. Cognate with Scots candilsteke, candilstik (“candlestick”). Compare Old Norse kertastika, kertistika (“candlestick”).

entries.meaning: A holder with a socket or spike for a candle.
(gymnastics) A gymnastics move in which the legs are pointed vertically upward.
(finance) A color-coded bar showing the open and closing prices of a stock on a candlestick chart.

verbs.description: candlestick (third-person singular simple present candlesticks, present participle candlesticking, simple past and past participle candlesticked)

entries.meaning: (of a parachute) To catch on fire, so that the chute resembles a tapered candle with a flame on top.
(investing) To analyze stock behavior using Japanese candlestick charts.
To form a tall, thin, tapering shape similar to a candle.
